title: PixelTone
description: a webapp facilitating the uploading of pictures to be analyzed by Microsoft’s Project Oxford DeepVision API to determine possible emotional indicators of people in the images, coupled with work that extracts a dominant color palette to be considered as input parameters to procedurally generate music fitting the input image’s ‘vibe’ through use of a knowledge base constructed with domain knowledge of harmony and rhythm, coupled with genetic evolutionary algorithms to produce a song in MIDI file format to be returned to the front end view and a displayed score for the user to follow along with. Recognized by Purdue’s Computer Science department as an exceptional project Spring 2016

title: Impromptune
description: a Java application extending on the feature set of Zong! viewer, while also implementing a dynamic music generation based on the current loaded musical score. We took a static musicXML score viewer and added many features to it while using a Scrum software development methodology.

title: Social Media Analytics and Reporting Toolkit (SMART)
description: TwitIE Named Entity Recongition system research and evaluation - developed Java API on top of GATE Embedded w/TwitIE for automation of entity extraction in microblog corpora to be integrated into future projects

title: query-by-humming engine
description: Information Search and Management final research project in developing a query by humming system to detect hummed melodies and match likely songs

title: Fiz / Flip
description: an interpreter shell for a simple functional language (in the spirit of LISP) from scratch written in C++ with Flex and Bison

title: Linux Shell
description: A robust alternative to bash Unix shell written in C++

title: MyHTTPD
description: a web server implemented with threads, thread pooling, and process pooling operating modes written in C/C++ supporting dynamicly loaded libraries

title: C / C++ networking
description: IPv4/IPv6 packet dumper for TCP, UDP, ARP, ICMP packets, multithreaded inflection server, multithreaded FTP server, SDN data center simulation / multi-tenant flow restrictions

title: Software Rasterizer
description: Built and extended a software rasterizer from scratch for rendering triangles, ray tracing, clipping, depth masking, texture mapping, model space/screen space interpolation, hard / soft shadows, projective textures, reflections, refractions, depth imposters for reflections

title: Purdue EPICS (Engineering Projects In Community Service, APPS - TADA)
description: TADA (Technology Assisted Dietary Assessment) Android application aims to provide a simple way to track your daily diet, provide recommendations, while researchers working with project advisor Dr. Edward Delp and VIPER lab students gather geo-tagged data and nutritional habits Implemented functionality to allow multiple UPC barcodes, images of meals to be batch processed by server to determine nutritional content for users Implemented a local datastore for client side caching of personal dietary history
Wave spawning FPS Android game built with Unity to learn basics of programming / game development
